attributes.action: A medal for all NHS staff & 2nd medal of gallantry for Nurses & Doctors
attributes.additional_details: Government / Parliament should do this in the same way that they would award campaign medals to the armed forces, after all the NHS staff are fighting a battle against a deadly enemy.
attributes.background: When Coronavirus is beaten, NHS staff should be recognised for what they have done to support the entire nation. A medal of recognition given to all. Those on the front line of this battle (Nurses, Doctors) deserve further special recognition & should receive a second medal of gallantry.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action.

Award Covid-19 medals to all emergency services and involved armed forces: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302613

A medal to honour the fortitude of people working in essential occupations: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308035

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/

Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
